title: Not cool
text:
I have the same complaint regarding the new app version as other people: without the animations that were present in older versions it’s not obvious what the system is doing. Yes, sure, now that I’ve read other reviews I realize that a blue temperature means the system is cooling, but one shouldn’t NEED to read reviews to understand how it works.

Oh, and I happen to be a software developer myself with a background in UI design, and a fundamental rule of designing a good GUI / HMI for widespread use is that you NEVER rely on color alone to provide information. Because there’s this thing called “color blindness” that affects a significant portion of the population and, well . . . see the problem there?

title: I have owned and used 5 years+
text:
I have had my moments. I’ve gone from ready to pull it and my hair out to pure satisfaction. It’s been like raising a child.  (A sick child sometimes.)
#1 frustration: Lennox support does not have any idea about what is going on. The app has gone through a couple of updates. When doing so it has quit working completely.  When eventually reaching Lennox support they had no idea as to what was happening. They are so clueless as to not even knowing they had such a product. I’ve never had any satisfaction from Lennox or their dealers. 
#1 solution: WAIT and you may wait a very long time. I’m talking months. It has always eventually worked out the issues. 
#2 frustration: Every update seems to have removed some features. In the beginning I recall I could adjust its temperature with the time of day. This feature no longer exists. I miss it. 
I’m building a new home so I have been researching other manufacturers Wi-Fi Thermostats. It appears that few owners are happy with their devices. 
Thinking back to business school I think I know what is going on. These little ad on features generate no revenue for the company. It’s a free-ish feature.  It’s probably contracted out to a cheap foreign developer. You get what you get but it’s still evolving. Patience has no fans. 
As of this writing it’s working great!

title: It’s an improvement
text:
I have to admit that until I read the response to one of Other reviews I was going to give the app a poor review. I couldn’t believe the system status was gone. Apparently it’s not... it’s there but not obvious. I’ll chaulk that off to poor communication... something we’re all quilty of from time to time. 
Anyway...I like the new format. It’s simple and unambiguous. What’s most impressive is the performance. Its tremendously better than before. That alone makes it ok for me.
 As for the system status bringing indicated by the color of the temperature... clever but not readily apparent. But, before we criticize this developer... Apple does this all the time with their products. After many years of using an iPhone I just found out that to undo a deletion in Notes you shake the phone! Who knew? Regardless, the color thing is not earth shattering.. give the developer a break

App needs update.

title: Half Baked.............
text: People who write reviews defending this interface must have some stake in the game.  Granted it works well when it works but is very unreliable which makes it pretty worthless.  We have two systems and the thermostats seem to be on different servers, one of which is unavailable half the time.  The interface requires a strong broad band signal to operate.  A weak signal is like no signal, won't operate on LTE.  I can stream video on LTE but can't even log onto these devices.  It now won't allow be to connect using home or office WiFi.  Don't let your H/C company convince this is cool, the idea is cool the reality is that it's not there yet, only half baked!!

title: Working fine
text: I’ve had a Lennox ac for two years now and use the app to check up on the system when I’m away for the summer.  It’s always worked fine.  Last summer it notified me of a problem and I was able to get the ac fixed.  Otherwise it would have been off for months in a hot humid environment.

title: It could not get much worse.
text:
This is about the worst thermostat app ever. I like the air conditioning unit and the wall unit isn’t too bad, but this app needs a lot of work. Changing the temperature and closing the app doesn’t always change the temperature. Regular service outages on holiday weekends, which is quite annoying. And no significant improvement to the app in the past couple years.

I really wish this company would invest more in their iPhone app. It would be great if they licensed the app from NEST or some other company with a good feature rich app.

I would give this app less than one star if possible.

title: Server error for me, works for partner
text:
This app worked fine for several years (across two iPhones) but just recently started giving me the dreaded "server error". Yet, my partner's phone can still connect, so it's clearly not the server, our router, or our account password. Deleting and reinstalling doesn't help, nor do hard reboots and any combination of wifi/cellular only/airplane mode access. 
The app was frustrating enough when it worked (no confirmation of a temperature change--did it work or do I need to spin the dial again?) and now it doesn't work at all with no means to fix it.

title: Working again
text:
When I updated to iOS 10 the iPhone app crashed. Now it's working again. I could only access the system from the mobile web site on my iPhone, my iPad which is too old for iOS 10, or from my laptop. 

I wish the iPhone app would show the outside temp like the iPad version. A refresh would also be nice. Had my system installed 3 years ago and the apps are still the same.

title: I mean, I guess it works?
text:
So I can actually change the temperature from my phone and if this would have been 5 years ago, it would be fine. 

But it’s not. 

And there are so many better wifi and app enabled thermostats out there these days. 

The HVAC system itself is amazing, and the way it was explained to me about how the thermostat constantly checks in with the rest of the units and only uses what it needs is great. 

But...where is the connection to Siri? Or Alexa? Or anything else?

Why can’t I add this to my iPhone home app?

Why do I have to create seasons and settings? Why can’t this learn what I like and keep it consistent year round without me having to adjust, manually, the settings?

While I love my new HVAC system, this thermostat has been a huge disappointment.

title: Fine when it works
text: I love the app when it works. Lately the problem is it fails to work about every other day. I have the app installed on two different iPhone models at two different iOS levels. I get a failure message either about issue with server or about failure to connect to the Internet. Yet the thermostat always thinks it is connected to the Internet. Sometimes the problem corrects itself in a few minutes. But it has lasted as long as 16 hours.

title: iOS 10.0.1 broke it???
text:
I have used this app for over a year without any issues.  I am on the other side of the wall of most others, since I had no issues and like it's functions.

Since applying the iOS 10.0.1 update, the app stopped working.  Not 100% sure it is the update but that is the most recent change.  Basically when I launch the app, I get the splash screen and then it just closes/crashes.

3 stars until its fixed.  Please fix this app!

title: Basics IF it connects to WiFi
text:
UPDATE: This app still intermittently claims my wifi is down when it is fully functional on other apps on all devices. Must we junk all three thermostats to acquire reliability. Lennox loses face here for sure. Can we get a ZERO STARS option?

One year ago: This app does the bare minimum required-Syncs with wifi when it chooses. Sometimes it reports intermittent lack of connection to WIFI after an iOS update.  

I really wish I had control over scheduling on my iPad, but it's impossible. 

My dear husband bought this 'high-tech' system because I've been bedridden for years with temperature-moderation challenges. He paid significantly for this HVAC system to get remote control, but the return is limited. What kind of a company fails on service in less than two years on a 10-15 year amortized product? Prospective buyers should be warned of Lennox's bad faith!

title: Finally fixed for iOS 10...Still needs feature upgrade
text:
Took too long to redo for iOS 10 after years of neglect. And still has has no feature additions since day 1. 

Those of us that bought new furnaces/ACs several years ago when these thermostats were the ones being furnished shouldn't have to be penalized because there is a new better model  thermostat (does that even work with all Lennox model furnaces?).

title: Needs lots of improvement
text:
The zoning often turns off by itself and we have to reset to get the zoning back on. 

One nice feature lennox should add is a schedule to run with zoning modes. Currently the schedule features only to turn off and on, but for people with split level, the whole point is to not heat areas where there’s no people. Lennox should really be better at this. Aren’t they supposed to be the gold standard to heating and air? 🤔 wouldn’t seem like a huge expense to update their thermostat system with downloadable fixes and make consumers happy?

title: Works well but...
text: The apps on the iPhone & iPad work well most of the time, but Lennox's servers seem to be going down more frequently. And yes I confirmed that my thermostat was connected as well as my iDevices. I used wifi as well as cellular on my iDevices. I even tried logging in thru their website, so it is obviously an issue with their servers. Hope they rectify this problem soon as it seems to be getting progressively worse over the past few months.

title: App not longer controls thermostat
text: In the past 6 months the app no longer controls the thermostat. Went out of town at set in away mode. Came back from my trip to find away mode was cooling house to 62 degrees! Away mode is supposed to set thermostat at 85. If away I had to set thermostat to 85 by scrolling the temperature wheel. That’s has now stopped working as well now. Left and used app to set temp to 85. App excepted temp but on my way home and getting into app to set the temp to start cooling again app had overrode it self and had been cooling the entire time.

title: Amazing Product
text: Amazing product with an amazing HVAC system. I have read a lot of negative posts and just laugh at the “specialists” who have read posts on the internet and think that they know more than the people that do this for a living 😂. Big thanks to my local Lennox dealer for getting me hooked up with this awesome system!

title: Very disappointed
text: After spending 20k to have 2 units (8 tons) of Lennox  “top of the line” equipment installed only to find out I have to use their terrible app and controller has made me one very disappointed consumer! It should be disclosed up front that they do not work with automated off the shelf systems like Nest. The only satisfaction I have is so far I have told 2 neighbors why they should cancel their planned installs of Lennox equipment and switch to other brands which they did! I have also banned any Lennox equipment from being used at my company or rentals. I plan on spreading the word!

title: Disappointed. When is the next update??
text: What with all the negative reviews, I am amazed that there hasn't been an improvement/update. I am very disappointed with this app. Prior to a new air conditioner install, I had a Nest thermostat which had a much better app. I was able to change my weekly schedule, see how long it would take to get to temperature. I could see how long and when my system ran over the last ten days and much more. I miss my Nest! I wish I had it back! It's amazing that Lennox hasn't had an update considering all the poor reviews.

title: Does what it needs to
text: This app is adequate for checking on your thermostat remotely and making adjustments to it. I even use it in the house when I'm upstairs and want to give the heat a boost when it's been chilly overnight, without having to get out of bed. The interface is easy to read and understand (on iPhone 4s) and I don't know why other reviewers are so negative about it.

title: Awful
text:
I had two zone system (Lennox) and had bought Honeywell Wi-Fi controllers for each using Redlink. They worked beautifully. Lots of functionality. Error proof. 
When I replaced my upstairs unit, my sales rep convinced me to switch to Lennox thermostat. I was left with impression that I “needed” to do this to be in synch with the new HVAC. Further, they took my old Honeywell unit when they finished the installation. 
It has been horrible!  
Very limited functionality and often unable to connect remotely. 
I will try to recover my old Honeywell unit or find one that will work with the Lennox.

title: Can I just add
text:
So this app is pretty horrible and Lennox doesn't seem to care. If you do, add geofencing. Why can't my "top of the line" AC system be smart enough to go into away mode when my smartphone is out of the area for some period of time? 

Why can't I choose an interface to use the only like the regular iComfort has. The wheel is awful. 

Why can't I set "away mode" for a set amount of time. I'll be back at 3, set away mode but then cancel away mode at 2:15...

title: Fine App
text: I'm not really sure what people's problem with this app is and why it gets such low marks. I guess people now days just expect too much. It does what it's supposed to do. It allows you to set the temperature on your air-conditioner remotely from your phone or your iPad whether you're on Wi-Fi or not. What more do you want?

title: iConfort by Lennox Wireless App.
text: I like the idea I can see the actual inside temperature anytime we are away and adjust it accordingly. I also can turn the system off via iPhone if I forget to do so at home. I also like the fact that I can adjust the temp for my comfort from my chair. Now if the rest of my life was just this sweet!

title: If you had a Nest, you are going to hate this
text:
For starters, you can't program the thermostat from the app. You have to stand at the wall to program it, just like your grandpa did in the 70's. Maybe that's meant to appeal to the hipster crowd by being old school. 

Second, just like grandpa's thermostat, you have a fixed number of slots you can program. Because apparently in 2017 they didn't have enough memory available for every 30 minutes like your nest can be configured. 

Third, its bright. As in light up the room bright. A thermostat should blend in. This feels like someone glued an iPad to your wall. 

I like the fact that you can upload a photo, but I'd much rather put that memory to better programmability. 

Two thumbs up for the AC which cools quickly and quietly. But one star for the half baked app and thermostat to run it.

title: I will reinstall Nest. Very disappointed
text:
I had to replace my all system. The vendor insisted that the new wall control system was much better than Nest. Not true for the owner! The app is poorly designed and buggy. After two seconds it changes all my settings. The user interface is from the 90's. 
Actually the wall system is better for the vendor and for Lennox as it sends private information to them.
If the system and the app was matching Nest quality, I could eventually accept sending private information as I was for Nest.

title: Lousy functionality
text: Huge disappointment.  Just got a new furnace - came with this thermostat.  Has less temperature control functionality than the 20 year old thermostat it just replaced.  It you want to always manually adjust your thermostat, and need to to do it from your phone, this is OK.  If you want to actually set up automatic programs to turn your heat up and down when you're away or asleep - you need to buy something else.  Like something 20 years old.  No monitoring.  No analytics.  No graphs or data.  Strictly 20th century stuff.

title: Utterly Broken in iOS 10!
text: This app hasn't had an update in over 2 years and now it's totally broken for anyone who updates to iOS 10. Seems like Lennox DOES not care about their original iComfort users and is in favor of pushing people to their new platform. I refuse to go buy a new thermostat every two years just to have features that are easily updatable via firmware and software update. No support whatsoever and utter garbage at best. Looks like I'll be going with the Nest at least they keep their software relatively up to date.

title: Not with IOS 10
text: Just purchased top of the line Lennox hvac system. Love it and the thermostat that came with it. A selling point was remote thermostat access with my iPhone or iPad. That worked fine on my iPhone 6s with IOS 9. I upgraded to IOS 10 and the app now opens and promptly crashes. I have done the normal delete reload etc. Nothing. Geez Lennox. If you sell me a product you have an obligation to keep it updated. This app was last updated n 2014. Of course I just found that out. Great system, great thermostat, lousy app support.

title: Doesn’t connect often and doesn’t show current HVAC status
text: When I open the app and see my HVAC it takes about 15 seconds to see if it’s running or not. I use to have nest and it was instant. Often times I change the temperature and it changes back to the previous setting. I have to change it 2 to 5 times until the temperature finally changes. Why can’t a large company not make a functional app without bugs. Lennox, invest money in app developers and make it work.

title: Poor design
text:
The thermostat and the app have poor design issues and they will not let you talk to a tech.  They make you talk to a dealer, if they don't know what they're doing, as in my case, you're screwed. 
On the app, it is very hard to change the temp. When you roll the dial it just jumps back. How about an up/down arrow?

If you are in a Season Program on the app or thermostat and you select the Manual menu you don't actually go there.  You go to a menu that has Cool only, Heat only, Heat and Cool and Off.
If you hit Off, the system is set to Heat and Cool. You then  have to tap the program icon again, select off again to turn the system OFF.

Update- you can not turn the system of from the app, it doesn't work at all!

title: Works great
text: So far this app has done exactly what it is suppose to do. It allow complete control of the thermostat for anywhere. Its nice because you can turn the ac off during the day and have it start cooling near the end the day on your way home to save energy and money. Its awesome.

title: No international set up option
text: This fancy thermostat came with my brand new 25 seer unit as part of the package.  It was purchased from an INTERNATIONAL Lennox dealer in the Cayman Islands.  However, for whatever reason, the programmers at Lennox have not realized that they can harness the power of the INTERNET and provide their international clients with a good service.  I HAD to set up my thermostat with my USA address, because there is NO OTHER option if I want to access the thermostat online, it now thinks the outside temperature is 54 degrees when I fact it’s 86.  Very lame.

title: Over 2 years of use and no problems here
text: I had this installed when we built our home. Have not had a single problem and works great when we are away. No complaints on this end. Few features I’d like to see in the coming updates but not a deal breaker at all..

title: Was good, but crashes in iOS 10
text:
App did everything I wanted in a mobile thermostat. Not a 1:1 of the wall unit, but perfect for a quick adjustment from elsewhere in the house or changing programs when away. 

BUT it now crashes at launch in iOS 10. I did all the usual stuff (restart, reinstall). Please fix!  Web interface still works, but less convenient.

title: Worst product ever
text: I wish I could give zero stars for this review.  The only reason I purchased this thermostat was that I could control the temperature of the house from any room using an app.  $500+ later, the app hasn't worked for over 3 months.  Lennox's response is that they're "working round the clock to fix the problem ".  I don't know about you, but I don't trust a company that takes 3 months to fix an app glitch which will take even longer to correct.

title: Wish I had read the reviews before buying
text: I wish I had read the reviews before buying this thermostat. VERY disappointing. Can't set programs up from the app or even from the website. No Help function; its there but it does laughably little. Can only change the temp from the app, manually, really nothing more at all. So so disappointing. This is 2017 for heavens sake. Thought I would want one in my other home but defined not now that I know how little the app does.

title: Good for Basic Needs
text: I was never a Nest user, so I can't comment on the differences. This app allows a user to see the inside temperature and make basic changes to their system as needed. Not sure what else people need. I've had no issues with the functionality.

title: iComfort by Lennox
text: Lennox did a great job designing the iConfort app for the iPad. It looks and acts just like my thermostat, and with the exception of editing programs, does everything my thermostat does. The internet connectivity has been flawless. The app for iPhone is, however, has been dummed down for a cleaner look, but at the expense of many features. Lennox needs to go back to the drawing boards amd make the iPhone app as awesome as the iPad app.

title: Absolute Garbage
text: Changes made on the app rarely update on the thermostat to change the temperature. The app will show the change processed and nothing happens - close the app and reopen and it will display the info before changes requested. I bought the top of the line Lennox XC25 with 4 zones and iComfort thermostat but might as well be heating my house by setting fires in trash cans and cooling with window units. Total waste of money with technology that simply doesn't work. It should be illegal to sell these fraudulently misrepresented systems.

title: Great idea! Needs to be more user friendly
text: We love that we can adjust or see the temperature setting through this app. However, the dial at the bottom of the screen to change the temp is very glitchy and doesn’t always change to the temp you want...perhaps a slider would make more sense?? Or make it bigger so it is easier to adjust?

title: Terrible App you’re tied to
text: Put in a new Lennox A/C unit (which we love) but required us to switch from our Nest thermostats to this. Talk about functionality from 1993. Can’t edit/adjust your schedules from the app, can’t see a history of your usage (hours the system ran), half the time won’t connect if you’re not home so you can’t override an “Away” setting on your way home from a vacation. Wouldn’t take this if it were free if we didn’t have to with the new unit

title: Was Great, Stopped Working
text: We were really live in our system. This app worked brilliantly for four months and now it doesn't work at all. Not on the iPhone or the iPad. Not sure what happened, but it thinks that these devices are no longer connected to the Internet. They must've really are. I checked every other app and the device itself, as well as our Internet connection. I don't know what happened, but I hope there's an update to fix it. Thank you.

title: Zero stars if I could
text: This app has not worked for me since the most recent iOS update, despite multiple delete and reload attempts. What is the point of having this app when I have to go do everything manually or use the cumbersome web page? Calling Lennox was just as frustrating. I felt I was more knowledgeable than the customer service rep. I also agree with previous reviews regarding lack of functionality of the app for iPhone.

title: Ok when it FiNALLY does what you want it to
text: I like the ability to control the settings when away from home but I find the app very slow to respond when trying to put the unit in away mode or turn off away mode. Needs to be more responsive. Had the app for about 3 +_ yrs now and it’s been slow the whole time.

title: Lacks functionalities
text: I have 4 a/c units in my home and own 2 new Lenox units. I would purchase 2 additional Lennox units if it was wasn't for the lack of functionalities. The thermostat has so much potential and even with all the user requests, still next to no updates have been done. Something as basic as being able to password lock and unlock your thermostat is non existent. I will stick with Nest until you guys come up with better updates.

title: Very basic
text: This is a dumbed down way to control your thermostats. You cannot edit programs and the interface is clunky. I should be able to look at both my thermostats simultaneously, but instead you have to choose one from your location and it takes up the entire screen. Some deeper menus would be nice.

title: I really like it
text: I like it on the iPhone.  I love that I can access it even using the cellular network and not necessarily being on wifi. Only problem:  iOS 10 makes it crash every time when trying to open it. I'm sure an update will address this.

title: Abandoned Broken App...
text:
While the app still controls the thermostat (away, temperature, etc), the app does not respect any programs that have been set on the device. Instead, if we have the system active, it sets the default temps to between 70 and 78. This leads to having the heater run to at night when we want it cooler and the AC to delay WELL past when we would prefer to have it on.

Please fix this. We have to CONSTANTLY manage this app in order to live IN OUR HOUSE.

title: Good enough I suppose
text: Does the job with no fuss. I have see other apps for different systems with graphs for showing temperatures, but this will do. Sometimes the app seems to not connect to the network and will show you an old temperature.  Buts that's not frequent.  I would like the ability to rename the zones though. Looks like Lenovo does not allow that.

title: Not working on iPhone after iOS 10
text: Had this on my iPhone for a few years and worked well but now after upgrading to iOS 10 it does not launch on my iPhone 6 anymore. Tried restarting the phone and also reinstalling the app but does not work. Funny thing is that in my iPad Pro it works OK with iOS 10. Please fix the iPhone version. Thanks.

title: Getting worse and worse
text: Lennox is not paying attention. Their server-side infrastructure is starting to break down. The app is unreliable, because the servers are losing connection to the registered devices. Customer support is no help, because they have only scripted steps for the customer to restart the home networking equipment. This is really simple stuff, but they clearly have not invested in the right level of talent in the software development group.

title: It really is bad
text: I’ve owned this thermostat for a few years now. It is constantly disconnecting. When that happens you can’t control your thermostat remotely. You then have to reconnect manually. If you are on vacation you are screwed. It also fails to recognize your programs when it resets. It seems to go back to some older settings and you have to start all over again. Lennox is very bad at this. Love the furnace, hate the thermostat and app. Be warned.

title: Poor app looses connection to sever constantly
text: Poor app with no programming on it.  Loses connection to the server all the time the connection is impossible to get back.  My connection has been down for a week now.  Internet works on phone but app doesn't recognize my internet connection. Do not buy this thermostat the wall unit looks good but that is it.  Buy a nest or some other controller/thermostat because this one stinks and does not do what they say it does.

title: Free to use, works as advertised.
text: I am glad we purchased the LENNOX setup we did. Everything works amazing and our energy bills have never been this low. This app is free to use and does exactly what it has been advertised to do. Good work LENNOX.

title: Does not work after downloading IOS 10.0.1 on iPhone 6
text: This halfway worked before I downloaded IOS 10.0.1 on my iPhone 6 and now all it does is shows to be opening then goes back to the Icon. There is a lot of improvements that could be made.

title: Can change temp remotely
text: Ok so the app is not perfect but if you just want to check or change the temp remotely, say cool the house before you get home because you haven’t set up a schedule, then yea it will do that. Alerts and reminders don’t show up now on app and I don’t think you can set up a schedule either.

title: Way behind the competition
text: I have three zones in my house. I used to have the Nest on all three, but learned that Nest doesn't support some of the advanced functions of a new system I installed (like variable fan speed) so I was forced to install a Lennox iComfort on the main zone. It's incredible how lacking in features it is! The app is incredibly basic...you can't set a schedule, do a permanent hold, and much more. I might have to look at something from Honeywell.

title: Read!
text: It’s pretty unbelievable that the top review of this app is complaining that the app doesn’t work with their Honeywell thermostat. Just because you have an archaic Lennox furnace that doesn’t mean some miracle app is going to make it communicate with your phone if you don’t have the Wi-Fi Lennox thermostat. It’s a LENNOX APP MEANT TO BE USED WITH A SPECIFIC LENNOX THERMOSTAT!

title: Works great
text: Lots of grouchy people in the world apparently. Kind of sad. Been using this app for 3 years on all my Apple devices and it’s always worked as advertised. Not a single issue. Ever. Simple and gets the job done.

title: It works well, I'm happy.
text:
OK, maybe not the best, but does what I need. My daughter has Nest, which was my plan, but this works fine.  

I like the wall unit better than Nest, buy Nest is fine too. 

My first heater required you to get on my knees to turn it on and off. It barely kept the small house warm in the California winters. This heats with 98% efficiency & cools with 20 SEER efficiency. Kick me if I complain.

Update 

September 18, 2016. OK you can kick me now.  I'm complaining. This system in IOS 10 / iPhone 7 does not work!
Bummer 😫

I'm sure a quality company like Lennox will fix this.

title: Very Intermittent
text:
If it would stay connected to the internet it would be Great. However, it frequently drops off line for a day or two.  When I'm away from home, this is a serious problem.  The router is located 4 feet across the hall, directly in front of the thermostat.
The internet signal is constant and robust.
Why can't this issue be overcome?

title: It works great!!
text: Not sure why low rating. Read some reviews complaining about how simple it is etc. It's dependable and let's you turn up or down and modes. Works great if therm is on other side of house 😆

title: This app needs work
text: App will not work at all now. It does not work with the Internet and does not open. It worked for a while and just stopped working. I used to be able to turn off my system or turn it on by phone and now it says I have no internet when I apparently do.

title: Works great (edit, not so great...)
text:
Does what it's suppose to. Easy to use and nice to be able to control my A/C from my iPhone.

edit...I've become disappointed with my thermostat. It loses connection all the time. Lennox needs to make their server more reliable. 

edit #2...Unfortunately this app is very dated. It's not even updated to for the larger screen size. C'mon Lennox, get your shot together. Give me a rest not to trash my thermostat for an Ecobee

title: Great App
text: My Lennox HVAC system was installed 3 years ago. The app has never failed. When I upgraded my iPhone 6 to IOS 10 last week, my phone automatically upgraded to the new version.

title: nest v lennox app
text:
tl:dr:: Nest is best

however, i have a top of the line 5 ton Lennox zone system, that I manage with Lennox control hardware and this app. In short, the functionality is fairly basic, but it works perfectly with no errors.

i use the nest in the basement with an cient system. it’s elegant and also works great.

title: Say What??!!
text: I totally agree with johnnyp702 - I have had a version of the IComfort app on my IPhone 6 for over a year. It suddenly wouldn't work, and I get the same message as he does - even when I delete and reload the app. It works just fine on my wife's IPhone and when I downloaded it to our IPad. I even downloaded a version onto an old Galaxy S3 I still have - and it worked there! How is this possible?!.

title: Needs lots of work
text: Just got a new system and needed to switch to this app. The temperature wheel is terrible and hard to get exactly where I need/want it. I also like other apps for other systems I have had that give you a  snap shot of all systems (we have three) on the home screen. This one forces me to go into each one to see what is happening. Not a strong app at all. Would like to see improvement.

title: Crashes on iOS 10. No app update in almost 3 years.
text: After updating to iOS 10, this app has not been able to load past the splash screen, quitting by itself after a minute. This issue has been replicated on multiple iOS 10 devices. I also see this app has not been updated since February 2014!!! What's the point in having a connected thermostat if the app is broken?!

title: works ok, STILL! needs improvement
text: The app works ok. the temperature control wheel still doesn't snap to the number so it takes multiple tries to set the temperature I want. Forget the gimmicky wheel, Just put a simple +/- button. That would make the app less frustrating and functional.

title: Terrible update
text:
Upgrade does not work on iphone5 or ipad2. Previous version worked great - please fix.

Update 9/5/13: so apparently this was a server issue with Lennox not their app. The server issue has been fixed according to Lennox and the app now works for me at least ...

title: App is faulty
text:
I have two thermostats in house and half the time one has a connectivity issue. It swaps between the two and the actual thermostat says connected. Lennox needs to hire some good app developers and fix this piece. I had no issues with previous wifi thermostats.

Update: Still a piece, I hope the people that run Lennox gets these thermostats shoved you their a's.  

Sell the business to someone that gives a crap.

title: Needs work
text:
There's no energy tracking to let you see how much heating or cooling you've been doing. Overall the interface feels clunky and amateurish. It's hard to know if you've even entered the temperature you want and the massive amount of space dedicated to the temp is just unnecessary. 

It's great to have this thermostat connected to the Internet, but in an era of Nest-level data this is like taking a trip back to the Stone Age.

title: Now works in iOS 10, still needs work
text: Updating my review since they now have a working update for iOS 10. Still needs a functional and visual refresh for the newer versions of iOS.

title: Works as intended
text: As others mention it is basic, and in serious need of an update (they maintain the s30 app but not this one). But it definitely lets you adjust major thermostat functions from your phone or web.

title: It works well
text: I don't understand the negative reviews. The app works. Is it fantastic? No. Is it functional? Yes. It does what it is supposed to do. It is not gorgeous but, honestly, what were people expecting from Lennox? I am happy with works. It does not have to compete for a design award.
